edu.example.embSys.mma.data
Class CsvFileWriter

java.lang.Object
  edu.example.embSys.mma.data.CsvFileWriter

public class CsvFileWriter
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for creating a new csv File, writing the data into the file and to close it, if the recording has finished.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Dionysios Satikidis (dionysios.satikidis@gmail.com)

Method Summary
static void closeFile()
          closes the file after recording has finished.
static void crtFile()
          If there is not already the path to store the files into created, this path will be created.

          Writes the captured data in the csv file.

Method Detail

crtFile

public static void crtFile()
If there is not already the path to store the files into created, this path will be created. A new file will be created here also. The name of the new file will be the current Timestamp. If the new file is created, the first line in the file will be: Count; Timestamp; AccX; AccY; AccZ; GPS-Alt; GPS-Lon; GPS-Lat; MicMaxAmpl; Acc Vector a

writeLine

public static void writeLine(java.lang.String cnt,
                             java.lang.String timestamp,
                             java.lang.String accx,
                             java.lang.String accy,
                             java.lang.String accz,
                             java.lang.String GPSAlt,
                             java.lang.String GPSLon,
                             java.lang.String GPSLat,
                             java.lang.String micMaxAmpl,
                             java.lang.String accVecA)
Writes the captured data in the csv file.

Parameters:
cnt - current count (tick)
timestamp - current timestamp
accx - current Accelerometer X-Value
accy - current Accelerometer Y-Value
accz - current Accelerometer Z-Value
GPSAlt - current GPS Altitude
GPSLon - current GPS Longitude
GPSLat - current GPS Latitude
micMaxAmpl - current maximum Microphone Amplitude
accVecA - = sqrt(accx²+accy²+accz²)

closeFile

public static void closeFile()
closes the file after recording has finished.
